intro: Mycetia lateriflora, commonly known as the side-flowered mycetia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color, arranged in clusters along the stems. Mycetia lateriflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
